description: From Arabic رُطْل‎ (ruṭl), variant of classical رِطْل‎ (riṭl), ultimately from Ancient Greek λίτρα (lítra).

entries.meaning: (historical units of measure) Alternative form of rottol: a former Middle Eastern and North African unit of weight, usually 1–5 pounds (0.5–2.5 kg).
examples: Dram (49·5 grains), 100=chequi, 4=oka (2·8286 ℔); dram (49·5 grains), 180=rotl, 100=kintal or kantar (127·29 ℔).
